sections.text: A river of molten glass flows through a canyon. A village elder asks you to retrieve a shard from its source.

options.description: Refuse; the task is too dangerous.

sections.text: Approaching the canyon, heat shimmers and the path narrows to a single ledge.

options.description: Search for a safer route downstream.

sections.text: You decline. The elder finds another and the village survives, but you wonder about courage.
A sudden tremor cracks the ledge. You lose footing and burn your arm reaching for a handhold.
Downstream you find a narrow tunnel that leads under the river to a hidden chamber.

options.description: Return and try the ledge again.

sections.text: You survive but are scarred. The shard you bring back is small but meaningful.
At the source you find a crystalline heart that cools the river when touched. You return a hero.
